meanings.definition: A type of enzyme that catalyzes the epimerization of a compound.
meanings.sent1: The epimerase helped change the shape of the molecule.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the epimerase to understand its role in chemical reactions.
meanings.sent3: The epimerase and the molecule had a dance-off to see who could change faster.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to adapt was like an epimerase, switching effortlessly between different tasks.
meanings.sent5: The epimerase was like a tiny wizard, magically transforming one molecule into another.

meanings.definition: A protein that facilitates the interconversion of epimers.
meanings.sent1: The epimerase in the cell helped convert one form to another.
meanings.sent2: Researchers discovered a new epimerase responsible for the conversion process.
meanings.sent3: The epimerase and the epimers threw a party to celebrate their transformations.
meanings.sent4: His influence on the team was like an epimerase, bringing different perspectives together.
meanings.sent5: The epimerase worked tirelessly, like a conductor orchestrating a symphony of molecular changes.
